wikipedia_page.main:
John Bentley (c. 1756 – 10 November 1813) was an English harpsichordist who was known in North America by the end of the American Revolution.
Bentley's musical career first brought him notability in Philadelphia where he founded the City Concerts. He formed a lasting connection with Quebec where he lived for 25 years. He held important positions there, the most notable being the overseer of roads. His main interest was music, and he should be considered an important part of Quebec's and Philadelphia's  musical history.

response: *John Bentley (rugby) (born 1966), English dual-code international rugby footballer

*John Bentley (Royal Navy officer) (died 1772), who gave his name to HMS Bentley (K465)
*John Bentley (musician) (born 1951), British bass guitarist for the UK band Squeeze
*The John Bentley School, Calne, Wiltshire, England

In 1816 he came to Canada to assume the post of organist at Holy Trinity Anglican Cathedral in Quebec City,Daniel Mendoza de Arce. Music in North America and the West Indies from the Discovery to 1850: A Historical Survey. Scarecrow Press; 2006. . p. 251. most likely succeeding John Bentley. He remained in that post up until his death in Quebec City 36 years later.
